   19: %%
   20: %%% Purpose : Test the timer module a simpler/faster test than timer_SUITE
   21: 
   22: -module(timer_simple_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: %% This test suite matches on opaque tref() return values from the *_after
   25: %% and *_interval functions, namely {instant, _}, {send_local, _}, {once, _}
   26: %% and {interval, _}.
   27: %% If the implementation changes, the test suite has to be changed accordingly.
   28: 
   29: %% external
   30: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   31:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   32:          init_per_testcase/2,
   33:          apply_after1/1,
   34:          apply_after2/1,
   35:          apply_after3/1,
   36:          apply_after4/1,
   37:          apply_after_invalid_args/1,
   38:          send_after1/1,
   39:          send_after2/1,
   40:          send_after3/1,
   41:          send_after4/1,
   42:          send_after5/1,
   43:          send_after6/1,
   44:          send_after7/1,
   45:          send_after_invalid_args/1,
   46:          exit_after1/1,
   47:          exit_after2/1,
   48:          exit_after3/1,
   49:          exit_after4/1,
   50:          kill_after1/1,
   51:          kill_after2/1,
   52:          kill_after3/1,
   53:          apply_interval1/1,
   54:          apply_interval_invalid_args/1,
   55:          send_interval1/1,
   56:          send_interval2/1,
   57:          send_interval3/1,
   58:          send_interval4/1,
   59:          send_interval5/1,
   60:          send_interval_invalid_args/1,
   61:          cancel1/1,
   62:          cancel2/1,
   63:          cancel3/1,
   64:          cancel4/1,
   65:          cancel5/1,
   66:          cancel6/1,
   67:          cancel_invalid_args/1,
   68:          sleep1/1,
   69:          sleep2/1,
   70:          tc/1,
   71:          unexpected1/1,
   72:          unexpected2/1,
   73:          unexpected3/1,
   74:          nonexistent1/1,
   75:          nonexistent2/1,
   76:          timer_perf/1]).
   77: 
   78: %% internal
   79: -export([forever/0,
   80:          do_nrev/2,
   81:          send/2,
   82:          timer/4,
   83:          timer/5]).
   84: 
   85: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   86: 
   87: suite() ->
   88:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   89:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   90: 
   91: all() ->
   92:     [
   93:         {group, apply_after},
   94:         {group, send_after},
   95:         {group, exit_after},
   96:         {group, kill_after},
   97:         {group, apply_interval},
   98:         {group, send_interval},
   99:         {group, cancel},
  100:         {group, sleep},
  101:         {group, misc}
  102:     ].
  103: 
  104: groups() -> 
  105:     [
  106:         {
  107:             apply_after,
  108:             [],
  109:             [
  110:                 apply_after1,
  111:                 apply_after2,
  112:                 apply_after3,
  113:                 apply_after4,
  114:                 apply_after_invalid_args
  115:             ]
  116:         },
  117:         {
  118:             send_after,
  119:             [],
  120:             [
  121:                 send_after1,
  122:                 send_after2,
  123:                 send_after3,
  124:                 send_after4,
  125:                 send_after5,
  126:                 send_after6,
  127:                 send_after7,
  128:                 send_after_invalid_args
  129:             ]
  130:         },
  131:         {
  132:             exit_after,
  133:             [],
  134:             [
  135:                 exit_after1,
  136:                 exit_after2,
  137:                 exit_after3,
  138:                 exit_after4
  139:             ]
  140:         },
  141:         {
  142:             kill_after,
  143:             [],
  144:             [
  145:                 kill_after1,
  146:                 kill_after2,
  147:                 kill_after3
  148:             ]
  149:         },
  150:         {
  151:             apply_interval,
  152:             [],
  153:             [
  154:                 apply_interval1,
  155:                 apply_interval_invalid_args
  156:             ]
  157:         },
  158:         {
  159:             send_interval,
  160:             [],
  161:             [
  162:                 send_interval1,
  163:                 send_interval2,
  164:                 send_interval3,
  165:                 send_interval4,
  166:                 send_interval5,
  167:                 send_interval_invalid_args
  168:             ]
  169:         },
  170:         {
  171:             cancel,
  172:             [],
  173:             [
  174:                 cancel1,
  175:                 cancel2,
  176:                 cancel3,
  177:                 cancel4,
  178:                 cancel5,
  179:                 cancel6,
  180:                 cancel_invalid_args
  181:             ]
  182:         },
  183:         {
  184:             sleep,
  185:             [],
  186:             [
  187:                 sleep1,
  188:                 sleep2
  189:             ]
  190:         },
  191:         {
  192:             misc,
  193:             [],
  194:             [
  195:                 tc,
  196:                 unexpected1,
  197:                 unexpected2,
  198:                 unexpected3,
  199:                 nonexistent1,
  200:                 nonexistent2,
  201:                 timer_perf
  202:             ]
  203:         }
  204:     ].
  205: 
  206: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  207:     Config.
  208: 
  209: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  210:     ok.
  211: 
  212: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  213:     Config.
  214: 
  215: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  216:     Config.
  217: 
  218: 
  219: init_per_testcase(_, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  220:     ok = timer:start(),
  221:     Config.
  222: 
  223: %% Testing timer interface!!
  224: 
  225: %% Test of apply_after with time = 0, with sending of message.
  226: apply_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  227:     Msg = make_ref(),
  228:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:apply_after(0, ?MODULE, send, [self(), Msg]),
  229:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  230: 
  231: %% Test of apply_after with time = 500, with sending of message.
  232: apply_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     Msg = make_ref(),
  234:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:apply_after(500, ?MODULE, send, [self(), Msg]),
  235:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  236: 
  237: %% Test that a request starts the timer server if it is not running.
  238: apply_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  239:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  240:     Msg = make_ref(),
  241:     timer:apply_after(100, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  242:     ok = get_mess(500, Msg),
  243:     {timer_server, Pid, worker, [timer]} = lists:keyfind(timer_server, 1, supervisor:which_children(kernel_sup)),
  244:     true = is_pid(Pid).
  245: 
  246: %% Test that a request starts the timer server if it is not running.
  247: apply_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  248:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  249:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  250:     Msg = make_ref(),
  251:     timer:apply_after(100, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  252:     ok = get_mess(500, Msg),
  253:     {timer_server, Pid, worker, [timer]} = lists:keyfind(timer_server, 1, supervisor:which_children(kernel_sup)),
  254:     true = is_pid(Pid).
  255: 
  256: %% Test that apply_after rejects invalid arguments.
  257: apply_after_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  258:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(-1, foo, bar, []),
  259:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, "foo", bar, []),
  260:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, foo, "bar", []),
  261:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, foo, bar, baz),
  262:     ok.
  263: 
  264: %% Test of send_after with time = 0.
  265: send_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  266:     Msg = make_ref(),
  267:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, Msg),
  268:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  269: 
  270: %% Test of send_after with time = 0 using a registered name.
  271: send_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  272:     Msg = make_ref(),
  273:     Name = register_name(self()),
  274:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, Name, Msg),
  275:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg),
  276:     unregister(Name).
  277: 
  278: %% Test of send_after with time = 0 using a registered name
  279: %% and node.
  280: send_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  281:     Msg = make_ref(),
  282:     Name = register_name(self()),
  283:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  284:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg),
  285:     unregister(Name).
  286: 
  287: %% Test of send_after with time = 500.
  288: send_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  289:     Msg = make_ref(),
  290:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(500, self(), Msg),
  291:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg).
  292: 
  293: %% Test of send_after with time = 500, with receiver a registered
  294: %% process. [OTP-2735]
  295: send_after5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  296:     Msg = make_ref(),
  297:     Name = register_name(self()),
  298:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, Name, Msg),
  299:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  300:     unregister(Name).
  301: 
  302: %% Test of send_after with time = 500 using a registered process
  303: %% and node.
  304: send_after6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  305:     Msg = make_ref(),
  306:     Name = register_name(self()),
  307:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  308:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  309:     unregister(Name).
  310: 
  311: %% Test that send_after works if the destination is a registered
  312: %% name which gets registered after the timer is started.
  313: send_after7(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  314:     Msg = make_ref(),
  315:     Name = make_name(),
  316:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, Name, Msg),
  317:     register(Name, self()),
  318:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  319:     unregister(Name).
  320: 
  321: %% Test that send_after rejects invalid arguments.
  322: send_after_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  323:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, test),
  324:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, self(), test),
  325:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, ?MODULE, test),
  326:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(0, "", test),
  327:     ok.
  328: 
  329: %% Test of exit_after with time = 1000.
  330: exit_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  331:     Msg = make_ref(),
  332:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  333:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  334:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Pid, Msg),
  335:     ok = get_mess(5000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  336: 
  337: %% Test of exit_after with time = 1000. The process to exit is the
  338: %% name of a registered process.  [OTP-2735]
  339: exit_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  340:     Msg = make_ref(),
  341:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  342:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  343:     Name = register_name(Pid),
  344:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Name, Msg),
  345:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  346: 
  347: %% Test of exit_after for sending an exit to self.
  348: exit_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  349:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  350:     Msg = make_ref(),
  351:     Pid = spawn_link(
  352:         fun () ->
  353:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Msg),
  354:             forever()
  355:         end
  356:     ),
  357:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  358: 
  359: %% Test that using exit_after to a non-existent
  360: %% process does not crash the timer server.
  361: exit_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  362:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  363:     timer:exit_after(0, make_name(), make_ref()),
  364:     receive
  365:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  366:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  367:     after 1000 ->
  368:         ok
  369:     end.
  370: 
  371: %% Test of kill_after with time = 1000.
  372: kill_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  373:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  374:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  375:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000, Pid),
  376:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  377: 
  378: %% Test of kill_after with time = 1000. The process to exit is the
  379: %% name of a registered process.  [OTP-2735]
  380: kill_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  381:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  382:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  383:     Name = register_name(Pid),
  384:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000, Name),
  385:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  386: 
  387: %% Test of kill_after for self-killing.
  388: kill_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  389:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  390:     Pid = spawn_link(
  391:         fun () ->
  392:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000),
  393:             forever()
  394:         end
  395:     ),
  396:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  397: 
  398: %% Test of apply_interval by sending messages. Receive
  399: %% 3 messages, cancel the timer, and check that we do
  400: %% not get any more messages.
  401: apply_interval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  402:     Msg = make_ref(),
  403:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_interval(1000, ?MODULE, send,
  404:                                      [self(), Msg]),
  405:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 3),
  406:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  407:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  408: 
  409: %% Test that apply_interval rejects invalid arguments.
  410: apply_interval_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  411:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(-1, foo, bar, []),
  412:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, "foo", bar, []),
  413:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, foo, "bar", []),
  414:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, foo, bar, baz),
  415:     ok.
  416: 
  417: %% Test of send_interval/2. Receive 5 messages, cancel the timer, and
  418: %% check that we do not get any more messages.
  419: send_interval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  420:     Msg = make_ref(),
  421:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, Msg),
  422:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 5),
  423:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  424:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg). % We should receive only five
  425: 
  426: %% Test of send_interval/3. Receive 2 messages, cancel the timer, and
  427: %% check that we do not get any more messages.
  428: send_interval2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  429:     Msg = make_ref(),
  430:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, self(), Msg),
  431:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  432:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  433:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).  % We should receive only two
  434: 
  435: %% Test of send_interval/3. Receive 2 messages, cancel the timer, and
  436: %% check that we do not get any more messages. The receiver is the
  437: %% name of a registered process. [OTP-2735]
  438: send_interval3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  439:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  440:     Msg = make_ref(),
  441:     Name = register_name(self()),
  442:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, Name, Msg),
  443:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  444:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  445:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg),  % We should receive only two
  446:     unregister(Name).
  447: 
  448: %% Test of send_interval/3 using a registered name and node.
  449: send_interval4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  450:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  451:     Msg = make_ref(),
  452:     Name = register_name(self()),
  453:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  454:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  455:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  456:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg), % We should receive only two
  457:     unregister(Name).
  458: 
  459: %% Test that send interval stops sending msg when the receiving
  460: %% process terminates.
  461: send_interval5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  462:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  463:     {ok, {interval, Ref}} = timer:send_interval(500, Msg1),
  464:     receive 
  465:         Msg1 -> ok
  466:     end,
  467:     timer_server ! {'DOWN', Ref, process, self(), test},
  468:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  469:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  470:     Msg2 = receive
  471:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  472:     end.
  473: 
  474: %% Test that send_interval rejects invalid arguments.
  475: send_interval_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  476:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, test),
  477:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, self(), test),
  478:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, ?MODULE, test),
  479:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(0, "", test),
  480:     ok.
  481: 
  482: %% Test that we can cancel an instant timer
  483: cancel1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  484:     Msg = make_ref(),
  485:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_after(0, Msg),
  486:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  487:     ok = get_mess(0, Msg). % We should rec 1 msg as it got sent immediately
  488: 
  489: %% Test that we can cancel a send-once timer.
  490: cancel2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  491:     Msg = make_ref(),
  492:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_after(1000, Msg),
  493:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  494:     nor = get_mess(2000, Msg). % We should rec 0 msgs
  495: 
  496: %% Test that we can cancel an apply-once timer.
  497: cancel3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  498:     Msg = make_ref(),
  499:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_after(1000, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  500:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  501:     nor = get_mess(2000, Msg).
  502: 
  503: %% Test that we can cancel a send-interval timer.
  504: cancel4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  505:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  506:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(500, Msg1),
  507:     receive
  508:         Msg1 -> ok
  509:     end,
  510:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  511:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  512:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  513:     Msg2 = receive
  514:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  515:     end.
  516: 
  517: %% Test that we can cancel an apply-interval timer.
  518: cancel5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  519:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  520:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_interval(500, erlang, send, [self(), Msg1]),
  521:     receive
  522:         Msg1 -> ok
  523:     end,
  524:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  525:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  526:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  527:     Msg2 = receive
  528:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  529:     end.
  530: 
  531: %% Test that cancelling non-existent timers does not crash the
  532: %% timer server. 
  533: cancel6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  534:     lists:foreach(
  535:         fun (TimerType) ->
  536:             Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  537: 	    {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel({TimerType, make_ref()}),
  538:             receive
  539:                 {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  540:                     error({timer_server_crashed, {cancel, TimerType}})
  541:             after 500 ->
  542:                 ok
  543:             end,
  544: 	    demonitor(Mon)
  545:         end,
  546: 	[once, instant, interval, send_local]
  547:     ).
  548: 
  549: %% Test that cancel rejects invalid arguments.
  550: cancel_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  551:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel(no_reference),
  552:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({foo, make_ref()}),
  553:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({once, foo}),
  554:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({interval, foo}),
  555:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({instant, foo}),
  556:     ok.
  557: 
  558: %% Test that sleep pauses the calling process for
  559: %% at least the given time.
  560: sleep1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  561:     T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  562:     ok = timer:sleep(1000),
  563:     T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  564:     true = T1 - T0 >= 1000,
  565:     ok.
  566: 
  567: %% Test that sleep accepts times >(2^32)-1, which is
  568: %% the maximum time for the after clause of a receive
  569: %% operation, at the time of this writing.
  570: sleep2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  571:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  572:     Pid = spawn_link(
  573:         fun () ->
  574:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000),
  575:             ok = timer:sleep(16#ffffffff+1)
  576:         end
  577:     ),
  578:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  579: 
  580: %% Test that unexpected calls do not crash the timer server.
  581: unexpected1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  582:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  583:     try
  584:         gen_server:call(timer_server, foo, 100)
  585:     of
  586:         _ ->
  587:             error(timeout_expected)
  588:     catch
  589:         exit:{timeout, _} ->
  590:             ok
  591:     end,
  592:     receive
  593:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  594:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  595:     after 500 ->
  596:         ok
  597:     end,
  598:     demonitor(Mon).
  599: 
  600: %% Test that unexpected casts do not crash the timer server.
  601: unexpected2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  602:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  603:     gen_server:cast(timer_server, foo),
  604:     receive
  605:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  606:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  607:     after 500 ->
  608:         ok
  609:     end,
  610:     demonitor(Mon).
  611: 
  612: %% Test that unexpected info messages do not crash the timer server.
  613: unexpected3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  614:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  615:     timer_server ! foo,
  616:     receive
  617:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  618:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  619:     after 500 ->
  620:         ok
  621:     end,
  622:     demonitor(Mon).
  623: 
  624: %% Test that timeouts of one-shot timers the timer server does not
  625: %% know are not executed.
  626: nonexistent1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  627:     Msg = make_ref(),
  628:     timer_server ! {timeout, make_ref(), {apply_once, {erlang, send, [self(), Msg]}}},
  629:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  630: 
  631: %% Test that timeouts of interval timers the timer server does not
  632: %% know are not executed.
  633: nonexistent2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  634:     Msg = make_ref(),
  635:     timer_server ! {timeout, make_ref, {apply_interval, erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond), 1000, make_ref(), {erlang, send, [self(), Msg]}}},
  636:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  637: 
  638: %% Test sleep/1 and tc/3.
  639: tc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  640:     %% This should test both sleep and tc/3
  641:     {Res1, ok} = timer:tc(timer, sleep, [500]),
  642:     ok = if
  643:              Res1 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res1}; % Too early
  644:              Res1 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res1};  % Too much time
  645:              true -> ok
  646:          end,
  647: 
  648:     %% tc/2
  649:     {Res2, ok} = timer:tc(fun(T) -> ok = timer:sleep(T) end, [500]),
  650:     ok = if
  651:              Res2 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res2}; % Too early
  652:              Res2 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res2};  % Too much time
  653:              true -> ok
  654:          end,
  655: 
  656:     %% tc/1
  657:     {Res3, ok} = timer:tc(fun() -> ok = timer:sleep(500) end),
  658:     ok = if
  659:              Res3 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res3}; % Too early
  660:              Res3 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res3};  % Too much time
  661:              true -> ok
  662:          end,
  663: 
  664:     %% Check that timer:tc don't catch errors
  665:     ok = try timer:tc(erlang, exit, [foo])
  666:          catch exit:foo -> ok
  667:          end,
  668: 
  669:     ok = try timer:tc(fun(Reason) -> 1 = Reason end, [foo])
  670:          catch error:{badmatch,_} -> ok
  671:          end,
  672: 
  673:     ok = try timer:tc(fun() -> throw(foo) end)
  674:          catch foo -> ok
  675:          end,
  676: 
  677:     %% Check that return values are propageted
  678:     Self = self(),
  679:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(erlang, self, []),
  680:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(fun(P) -> P end, [self()]),
  681:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(fun() -> self() end),
  682: 
  683:     Sec = timer:seconds(4),
  684:     Min = timer:minutes(4),
  685:     Hour = timer:hours(4),
  686:     MyRes = 4*1000 + 4*60*1000 + 4*60*60*1000,
  687:     if  MyRes == Sec + Min + Hour -> ok end,
  688:     TimerRes = timer:hms(4,4,4),
  689:     if MyRes == TimerRes -> ok end,
  690:     ok.
  691: 
  692: get_mess(Time, Mess) -> get_mess(Time, Mess, 1).
  693: get_mess(_, _, 0) -> ok;  % Received
  694: get_mess(Time, Mess, N) ->
  695:     receive 
  696:         Mess -> get_mess(Time, Mess, N-1)
  697:     after Time ->
  698:         nor   % Not Received
  699:     end.
  700: 
  701: forever() ->
  702:     ok = timer:sleep(1000),
  703:     forever().
  704: 
  705: 
  706: %%
  707: %% Testing for performance (on different implementations) of timers
  708: %%
  709: 
  710: 
  711: timer_perf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  712:     performance(timer).
  713: 
  714: performance(Mod) ->
  715:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),    
  716:     {Y,Mo,D} = date(),
  717:     {H,M,S} = time(),
  718:     io:format("Testing module '~p' Date: ~w/~w/~w ~w:~w:~w~n", 
  719:               [Mod,Y,Mo,D,H,M,S]),
  720:     Result = big_test(Mod),
  721:     report_result(Result).
  722: 
  723: big_test(M) ->
  724:     Load_Pids = start_nrev(20, M),   % Increase if more load wanted :)
  725: 
  726:     LPids = spawn_timers(5, M, 10000, 5),
  727: 
  728:     apply(M, sleep, [4000]),
  729:     MPids = spawn_timers(10, M, 1000, 6),
  730: 
  731:     apply(M, sleep, [3500]),
  732:     SPids = spawn_timers(15, M, 100, 3),
  733: 
  734:     Res = wait(SPids ++ MPids ++ LPids, [], 0, M),
  735: 
  736:     lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> exit(Pid, kill) end, Load_Pids),
  737:     Res.
  738: 
  739: wait([], Res, N, _) ->
  740:     {Res, N};
  741: wait(Pids, ResList, N, M) ->
  742:     receive
  743:         {Pid, ok, Res, T} ->
  744:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), [{T, Res} | ResList], N, M);
  745:         {Pid, Error}->
  746:             ct:fail(Error),
  747:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), ResList, N+1, M);
  748:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  749:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), ResList, N, M);
  750:         {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  751:             ct:fail({Pid,Reason})
  752:     end.
  753: 
  754: spawn_timers(0, _, _, _) ->
  755:     [];
  756: spawn_timers(N, M, T, NumIter) ->
  757:     apply(M, sleep, [120*N]),
  758:     Pid1 = spawn_link(?MODULE, timer, [apply, M, T, self()]),
  759:     Pid2 = spawn_link(?MODULE, timer, [interval, M, T, self(), NumIter]),
  760:     [Pid1, Pid2 | spawn_timers(N-1, M, T, NumIter)].
  761: 
  762: timer(apply, Mod, T, Pid) ->
  763:     Before = system_time(),
  764:     {ok, Ref} = apply(Mod, apply_after, [T, ?MODULE, send, [self(), done]]),
  765:     receive 
  766:         done ->
  767:             After = system_time(),
  768:             Pid ! {self(), ok, (After-Before) div 1000, T}
  769:     after T*3 + 300 ->   % Watch dog
  770:             io:format("WARNING TIMER WATCHDOG timed out: ~w ~n", [T]),
  771:             {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  772:             Pid ! {self(), watch_dog_timed_out}
  773:     end.
  774: 
  775: timer(interval, Mod, T, Pid, NumIter) ->
  776:     Before = system_time(),
  777:     {ok, Ref} = apply(Mod, apply_interval, [T, ?MODULE, send, [self(), done]]),
  778:     timer_irec(Before, T, {0, NumIter}, [], {Pid, Mod, Ref}).
  779: 
  780: timer_irec(_Start, T, {N, N}, Res, {Pid, Mod, Ref}) ->
  781:     apply(Mod, cancel, [Ref]),
  782:     Min = lists:min(Res),
  783:     Max = lists:max(Res),
  784:     Tot = lists:sum(Res),
  785:     Pid ! {self(), ok, {N, Tot, Tot div N, Min, Max}, T};
  786: timer_irec(Start, T, {N, Max}, Res, {Pid, Mod, Ref}) ->
  787:     receive
  788:         done ->
  789:             Now = system_time(),
  790:             Elapsed = (Now - (Start + (N*T*1000))) div 1000,
  791:             timer_irec(Start, T,
  792:                        {N+1, Max},
  793:                        [Elapsed | Res],
  794:                        {Pid, Mod, Ref})
  795:     after T*3 + 300 ->
  796:             apply(Mod, cancel, [Ref]),
  797:             io:format("WARNING: TIMER WATCHDOG timed out <Interval>~w~n",[T]),
  798:             Pid ! {self(), timer_watchdog_timed_out_in_interlval_test}  
  799:     end.
  800: 
  801: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  802: %%  Small last generator
  803: 
  804: start_nrev(0, _) ->
  805:     [];
  806: 
  807: start_nrev(N, M) ->
  808:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, do_nrev, [N, M]),
  809:     [Pid | start_nrev(N-1, M)].
  810: 
  811: do_nrev(Sleep, Mod) ->
  812:     apply(Mod, sleep, [50 * Sleep]),
  813:     test(1000,"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz1234"),
  814:     ok.
  815: 
  816: test(0,_) ->
  817:     true;
  818: test(N,L) ->
  819:     nrev(L),
  820:     test(N - 1, L).
  821: 
  822: nrev([]) ->
  823:     [];
  824: nrev([H|T]) ->
  825:     append(nrev(T), [H]).
  826: 
  827: append([H|T],Z) ->
  828:     [H|append(T,Z)];
  829: append([],X) ->
  830:     X.
  831: 
  832: system_time() ->    
  833:     erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond).
  834: 
  835: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  836: 
  837: report_result({Res, 0}) ->
  838:     {A_List, I_List} = split_list(Res, [], []),
  839:     A_val = calc_a_val(A_List),
  840:     I_val = calc_i_val(I_List),
  841:     print_report(A_val, I_val),
  842:     ok;
  843: 
  844: report_result({Head, N}) ->
  845:     io:format("Test Failed: Number of internal tmo ~w~n", [N]),
  846:     ct:fail({Head, N}).
  847: 
  848: split_list([], AL, IL) ->
  849:     {AL, IL};
  850: split_list([{T, {N, Tot, A, Min, Max}} | Rest], AL, IL) ->
  851:     split_list(Rest, AL, [{T, {N, Tot, A, Min, Max}} | IL]);
  852: split_list([Head | Rest], AL, IL) ->
  853:     split_list(Rest, [Head | AL], IL).
  854: 
  855: split([{T, Res} | R]) ->
  856:     split(R, {{T,[Res]}, {T*10,[]}, {T*100,[]}}).
  857: 
  858: split([{T, Res} | R], {{T,S}, M, L}) ->
  859:     split(R, {{T,[Res|S]}, M, L});
  860: 
  861: split([{T, Res} | R], {S, {T,M}, L}) ->
  862:     split(R, {S, {T, [Res|M]}, L});
  863: 
  864: split([{T, Res} | R], {S, M, {T,L}}) ->
  865:     split(R, {S, M, {T, [Res|L]}});
  866: 
  867: split(_Done, Vals) ->
  868:     Vals.
  869: 
  870: calc_a_val(List) ->
  871:     New = lists:sort(List),
  872:     {{T1, S}, {T2, M}, {T3, L}} = split(New),
  873:     S2 = {length(S), lists:max(S), lists:min(S), 
  874:           lists:sum(S) div length(S)},
  875:     M2 = {length(M), lists:max(M), lists:min(M), 
  876:           lists:sum(M) div length(M)},
  877:     L2 = {length(L), lists:max(L), lists:min(L), 
  878:           lists:sum(L) div length(L)},
  879:     [{T1, S2}, {T2, M2}, {T3, L2}].
  880: 
  881: calc_i_val(List) ->
  882:     New =  lists:sort(List),
  883:     {{T1, S}, {T2, M}, {T3, L}} = split(New),
  884:     S2 = get_ivals(S),
  885:     M2 = get_ivals(M),
  886:     L2 = get_ivals(L),
  887:     [{T1, S2}, {T2, M2}, {T3, L2}].
  888: 
  889: get_ivals(List) ->
  890:     Len = length(List),
  891:     Num = element(1, hd(List)), % Number of iterations
  892: 
  893:     LTot = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(2, X) end, List),
  894:     LMin = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(4, X) end, List),
  895:     LMax = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(5, X) end, List),
  896: 
  897:     MaxTot  = lists:max(LTot),
  898:     MinTot  = lists:min(LTot),
  899:     AverTot = lists:sum(LTot) div Len,
  900: 
  901:     IterMax = lists:max(LMax),
  902:     IterMin = lists:min(LMin),
  903:     IterAver= AverTot div Num,
  904: 
  905:     {Len, Num,
  906:      {MaxTot, MinTot, AverTot}, 
  907:      {IterMax, IterMin, IterAver}}.
  908: 
  909: 
  910: print_report(A_L, I_L) ->
  911:     io:format("~nRESULTS from timer test~n~n",[]),
  912:     io:format("Time out times for send_after~n~n", []),
  913:     io:format("Time No of tests  Max    Min  Average~n",[]),
  914:     print_aval(A_L),
  915:     io:format("Time out times for send_interval~n~n", []),
  916:     io:format("Time No.tests  No.intvals TotMax TotMin TotAver  MaxI   MinI  AverI~n", []),
  917:     print_ival(I_L).
  918: 
  919: print_aval([]) ->
  920:     io:format("~n~n", []);
  921: print_aval([{T, {L, Max, Min, Aver}}|R]) ->
  922:     io:format("~5w ~8w ~6w ~6w ~8w ~n", 
  923:               [T,L,Max,Min,Aver]),
  924:     print_aval(R).
  925: 
  926: print_ival([]) ->
  927:     io:format("~n", []);
  928: print_ival([{T, {Len, Num, 
  929:                  {MaxT, MinT, AverT},
  930:                  {MaxI, MinI, AverI}}}|R]) ->
  931:     io:format("~5w ~6w ~10w ~8w ~6w ~6w ~6w ~6w ~6w~n", 
  932:               [T,Len,Num,MaxT,MinT,AverT, MaxI, MinI, AverI]),
  933:     print_ival(R).
  934: 
  935: send(Pid, Msg) ->
  936:     Pid ! Msg.
  937: 
  938: %% Create a unique name and register it to the given process.
  939: register_name(Pid) ->
  940:     Name = make_name(),
  941:     register(Name, Pid),
  942:     Name.
  943: 
  944: %% Create a unique name.
  945: make_name() ->
  946:     list_to_atom(ref_to_list(make_ref())).
